meanings.sent1: The ungain puppy struggled to climb the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She felt ungain as she tried to dance in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The ungain penguin slipped on the ice, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His ungain movements on the dance floor resembled a newborn foal.
meanings.sent5: The ungain giraffe tried to squeeze through the narrow gate, causing a commotion.

meanings.sent1: It was ungain for him to skip breakfast before the big race.
meanings.sent2: She realized it was ungain to invest in that risky business.
meanings.sent3: The ungain decision to go out without an umbrella led to a drenched walk home.
meanings.sent4: His ungain choice of words offended his friend unintentionally.
meanings.sent5: The ungain shortcut through the dark alley proved to be a mistake.

meanings.definition: To fail to obtain or achieve
meanings.sent1: He would ungain the treasure if he didn't solve the riddle.
meanings.sent2: She feared she might ungain her dream job if she didn't prepare well.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to ungain the rabbit from the hat failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The team would ungain victory if they didn't work together.
meanings.sent5: She didn't want to ungain the opportunity to travel the world.
